section_list.name: Messages for Location Information Transfer Procedures
E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by LMF to initiate E-CID measurements.
Direction: LMF ? NG-RAN node.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same NRPPa Transaction ID. The NRPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The NRPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.1.1.1 - Measurement Periodicity IE - ifReportCharacteristicsPeriodic: This IE shall be present if the Report Characteristics IE is set to the value "Periodic".

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
ENUMERATED (Cell-ID, Angle of Arrival, Timing Advance Type 1, Timing Advance Type 2, RSRP, RSRQ, …)

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by NG-RAN node to indicate that the requested E-CID measurement is successfully initiated.
Direction: NG-RAN node ? LMF.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same NRPPa Transaction ID. The NRPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The NRPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

9.2.5 E-CID Measurement Result - Section Description: The purpose of the E-CID Measurement Result information element is to provide the E-CID measurement result. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "Periodic", the NG-RAN node shall initiate the requested measurements and shall reply with the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message without including either the E-CID Measurement Result IE or the Cell Portion ID IE in this message. The NG-RAN node shall then periodically initiate the E-CID Measurement Report procedure for the measurements, with the requested reporting periodicity.
9.2.5 Serving Cell ID IE Semantics: NG-RAN Cell Identifier of the serving cell 9.2.6 NG-RAN CGI - Section Description: The NG-RAN Cell Global Identifier (CGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.8 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 Serving Cell TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code of the serving cell 9.2.11 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.

9.2.5 NG-RAN Access Point Position IE Semantics: The configured estimated geographical position of the antenna of the cell. 9.2.10 NG-RAN Access Point Position - Section Description: The NG-RAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an NG-RAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [8]. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.2.10 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.10 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.10 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude "h" expressed in metres is derived from the "uncertainty code" k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested.
9.2.5 Value Angle of Arrival EUTRA IE Semantics: According to mapping in TS 36.133 [9]
9.2.5 Value Timing Advance Type 1 EUTRA IE Semantics: According to mapping in TS 36.133 [9]
9.2.5 Value Timing Advance Type 2 EUTRA IE Semantics: According to mapping in TS 36.133 [9]
9.2.5 PCI EUTRA IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier of the reported E-UTRA cell
9.2.5 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL for FDD and NDL/UL for TDD in ref. TS 36.104 [7]
9.2.5 CGI EUTRA IE Semantics: Cell Global Identifier of the reported E-UTRA cell 9.2.6 NG-RAN CGI - Section Description: The NG-RAN Cell Global Identifier (CGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.8 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 PCI EUTRA IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier of the reported E-UTRA cell 9.2.7 CGI EUTRA - Section Description: The Cell Global Identifier EUTRA is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell.

9.2.8 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL for FDD and NDL/UL for TDD in ref. TS 36.104 [7]
9.2.5 CGI EUTRA IE Semantics: Cell Global Identifier of the reported E-UTRA cell 9.2.7 CGI EUTRA - Section Description: The Cell Global Identifier EUTRA is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell.

9.2.8 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node or LMF when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. The conditions for inclusion of the NRPPa Transaction ID IE are described in clause 10.

9.2.2 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.2 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.2 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same NRPPa Transaction ID. The NRPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The NRPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.2 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.2 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

9.2.12 Cell Portion ID - Section Description: This parameter gives the current Cell Portion associated with the target UE. The Cell Portion ID is the unique identifier for a cell portion within a cell. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "Periodic", the NG-RAN node shall initiate the requested measurements and shall reply with the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message without including either the E-CID Measurement Result IE or the Cell Portion ID IE in this message. The NG-RAN node shall then periodically initiate the E-CID Measurement Report procedure for the measurements, with the requested reporting periodicity.
9.2.13 Other-RAT Measurement Result - Section Description: The purpose of the Inter-RAT Measurement Result information element is to provide the Inter-RAT measurement results.
9.2.13 UTRA EcNo IE Semantics: This IE applies to FDD only.

9.2.14 WLAN Measurement Result - Section Description: The WLAN Measurement Result information element provides the WLAN measurement results. 8.2.1 E-CID Measurement Initiation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand", the NG-RAN node shall return the result of the measurement in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message including, if available, the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE in the E-CID Measurement Result IE, and the LMF shall consider that the E-CID measurements for the UE has been terminated by the NG-RAN node. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the Cell Portion ID IE in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. Upon reception of the Cell Portion ID IE, the LMF may use the value as the cell portion for the measurement. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the Inter-RAT Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the Inter-RAT Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message. If the Report Characteristics IE is set to "OnDemand" and the WLAN Measurement Quantities IE is included in the E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION REQUEST message, the NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the corresponding measurements, if available in the NG-RAN node, in the WLAN Measurement Result IE in E-CID MEASUREMENT INITIATION RESPONSE message.
9.2.14 SSID IE Semantics: Includes the SSID field as defined in subclause 8.4.2.2 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 BSSID IE Semantics: Includes the BSSID field as defined in subclause 8.2.4.3.4 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 HESSID IE Semantics: Includes the HESSID field as defined in subclause 8.4.2.94 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 Operating Class IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN Operating Class as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 Country Code IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN country code as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 WLAN Channel IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN channel number as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 WLAN Band IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN band as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].

9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. 9.2.1 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.
ENUMERATED (Unspecified, Requested Item not Supported, Requested Item Temporarily not Available, ... )

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT FAILURE INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by NG-RAN node to indicate that the previously requested E-CID measurement can no longer be reported.
Direction: NG-RAN node ? LMF.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same NRPPa Transaction ID. The NRPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The NRPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.1 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.
ENUMERATED (Unspecified, Requested Item not Supported, Requested Item Temporarily not Available, ... )

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)

section_list.name: E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT
aoa:
This message is sent by NG-RAN node to report the results of the requested E-CID measurement.
Direction: NG-RAN node ? LMF.
9.2.3 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same NRPPa Transaction ID. The NRPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The NRPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.

9.2.5 E-CID Measurement Result - Section Description: The purpose of the E-CID Measurement Result information element is to provide the E-CID measurement result. 8.2.3 E-CID Measurement Report 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested. If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE which is the configured estimated serving antenna position in the E-CID Measurement Result IE within the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message. Upon reception of this NG-RAN Access Point Position IE, the LMF may use the value as the geographical position of the NG-RAN access point.
9.2.5 Serving Cell ID IE Semantics: NG-RAN Cell Identifier of the serving cell 9.2.6 NG-RAN CGI - Section Description: The NG-RAN Cell Global Identifier (CGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

9.2.8 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.5 Serving Cell TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code of the serving cell 9.2.11 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.

9.2.5 NG-RAN Access Point Position IE Semantics: The configured estimated geographical position of the antenna of the cell. 9.2.10 NG-RAN Access Point Position - Section Description: The NG-RAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an NG-RAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [8]. 8.2.3 E-CID Measurement Report 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation If available, the NG-RAN node shall include the NG-RAN Access Point Position IE which is the configured estimated serving antenna position in the E-CID Measurement Result IE within the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message. Upon reception of this NG-RAN Access Point Position IE, the LMF may use the value as the geographical position of the NG-RAN access point.
9.2.10 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.10 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.10 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude "h" expressed in metres is derived from the "uncertainty code" k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

8.2.3 E-CID Measurement Report 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation The Measured Results IE shall be included in the E-CID Measurement Result IE of the E-CID MEASUREMENT REPORT message when measurement results other than the "Cell-ID" have been requested.

9.2.15 OTDOA Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains OTDOA information of a cell/TP.

9.2.15 CGI EUTRA IE Semantics: Cell Global Identifier of the E-UTRA cell. 9.2.7 CGI EUTRA - Section Description: The Cell Global Identifier EUTRA is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell.

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ...)
9.2.15 PRS Bandwidth EUTRA IE Semantics: Transmission bandwidth of PRS
9.2.15 PRS Configuration Index EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS Configuration Index, ref TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.15 CP Length EUTRA IE Semantics: Cyclic prefix length of the PRS
9.2.15 Number of DL Frames EUTRA IE Semantics: Number of consecutive downlink subframes NPRS with PRS, ref TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.15 Number of Antenna Ports EUTRA IE Semantics: Number of used antenna ports, where n1-or-n2 corresponds to 1 or 2 ports, n4 corresponds to 4 ports

9.2.15 SFN Initialisation Time EUTRA IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second.

9.2.15 NG-RAN Access Point Position IE Semantics: The configured estimated geographical position of the antenna of the cell/TP. 9.2.10 NG-RAN Access Point Position - Section Description: The NG-RAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an NG-RAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [8].
9.2.10 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.10 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.10 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude "h" expressed in metres is derived from the "uncertainty code" k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

9.2.15 PRS Muting Configuration EUTRA IE Semantics: The configuration of positioning reference signals muting pattern. 9.2.16 PRS Muting Configuration EUTRA - Section Description: The PRS Muting Configuration EUTRA IE is used to describe the configuration of PRS muting patterns for the concerned cell/TP, according to TS 36.211 [10] and TS 36.133 [9].

9.2.16 Two IE Semantics: If a bit is set to "0", it indicates that the PRS is muted in the corresponding PRS positioning occasion (numbering from any sub frame for which SFN=0) in a periodic cycle of length equal to the length of the bit string
9.2.16 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 thirty-two IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 sixty-four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 one-hundred-and-twenty-eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 two-hundred-and-fifty-six IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 five-hundred-and-twelve IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 one-thousand-and-twenty-four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.15 PRS-ID EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS ID, ref TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.15 TP-ID EUTRA IE Semantics: Identity of the transmission point. This IE together with the PCI and/or PRS-ID may be used to identify the transmission point in case the same physical cell ID is shared by multiple transmission points.
9.2.15 TP Type EUTRA IE Semantics: A TP which transmits PRS only.
9.2.15 Number of DL Frames-Extended EUTRA IE Semantics: Number of consecutive downlink subframes NPRS with PRS, ref TS 36.211 [10].
9.2.15 CRS CP Length EUTRA IE Semantics: Cyclic prefix length of the CRS.
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ...)
9.2.15 DL Bandwidth EUTRA IE Semantics: DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks NRB, ref TS 36.104 [7].
ENUMERATED (og2, og4, og8, og16, og32, og64, og128, ...)
9.2.15 PRS Occasion Group EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS occasion group in a PRS period, ref TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.15 PRS Frequency Hopping Configuration EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS frequency hopping configuration. 9.2.17 PRS Frequency Hopping Configuration EUTRA - Section Description: The PRS Frequency Hopping Configuration EUTRA IE is used to describe the configuration of PRS frequency hopping for the concerned cell/TP, according to TS 36.211 [10].
9.2.17 Number of Frequency Hopping Bands IE Semantics: Number of bands for frequency hopping.
9.2.17 NarrowBand Index IE Semantics: Narrowband Index
ENUMERATED ( sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6, … )

9.2.15 TDD Configuration EUTRA IE Semantics: TDD specific physical channel configuration. 9.2.18 TDD Configuration EUTRA - Section Description: The TDD Configuration EUTRA IE is used to specify the TDD specific physical channel configuration. 9.2.18 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: sa0 points to Configuration 0, sa1 to Configuration 1 etc. as specified in TS 36.211 [6, table 4.2-2].

When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing. The conditions for inclusion of the NRPPa Transaction ID IE are described in clause 10.

9.2.2 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.2 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.2 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

9.2.4 NRPPa Transaction ID - Section Description: The NRPPa Transaction ID IE is used to associate all the messages belonging to the same procedure. Messages belonging to the same procedure shall use the same NRPPa Transaction ID. The NRPPa Transaction ID is determined by the initiating peer of a procedure. The NRPPa Transaction ID shall uniquely identify a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures using the same procedure code, and initiated by the same protocol peer.
9.2.2 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.2 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

aoa: 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: NG-RAN Access Point Position
aoa: The NG-RAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an NG-RAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [8].
9.2.10 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.10 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.10 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude "h" expressed in metres is derived from the "uncertainty code" k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

section_list.name: TAC
aoa: 9.2.11 TAC IE Semantics: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.

section_list.name: Cell Portion ID
aoa: 9.2.12 Cell Portion ID IE Semantics: This parameter gives the current Cell Portion associated with the target UE. The Cell Portion ID is the unique identifier for a cell portion within a cell.

section_list.name: Other-RAT Measurement Result
aoa: 9.2.13 Other-RAT Measured Results IE Semantics: The purpose of the Inter-RAT Measurement Result information element is to provide the Inter-RAT measurement results.
9.2.13 UTRA EcNo IE Semantics: This IE applies to FDD only.

section_list.name: WLAN Measurement Result
aoa: 9.2.14 WLAN Measured Results IE Semantics: The WLAN Measurement Result information element provides the WLAN measurement results.
9.2.14 SSID IE Semantics: Includes the SSID field as defined in subclause 8.4.2.2 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 BSSID IE Semantics: Includes the BSSID field as defined in subclause 8.2.4.3.4 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 HESSID IE Semantics: Includes the HESSID field as defined in subclause 8.4.2.94 of IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 Operating Class IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN Operating Class as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 Country Code IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN country code as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 WLAN Channel IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN channel number as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].
9.2.14 WLAN Band IE Semantics: Indicates the WLAN band as defined in IEEE 802.11™ [11].

section_list.name: OTDOA Cell Information
aoa: 9.2.15 OTDOA Cell Information IE Semantics: This IE contains OTDOA information of a cell/TP.
9.2.15 PCI EUTRA IE Semantics: Physical Cell ID of the reported E-UTRA cell.
9.2.15 CGI EUTRA IE Semantics: Cell Global Identifier of the E-UTRA cell. 9.2.7 CGI EUTRA - Section Description: The Cell Global Identifier EUTRA is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell.

9.2.8 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.8 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.15 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.11 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.
9.2.15 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL for FDD and NDL/UL for TDD in ref. TS 36.104 [7].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ...)
9.2.15 PRS Bandwidth EUTRA IE Semantics: Transmission bandwidth of PRS
9.2.15 PRS Configuration Index EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS Configuration Index, ref TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.15 CP Length EUTRA IE Semantics: Cyclic prefix length of the PRS
9.2.15 Number of DL Frames EUTRA IE Semantics: Number of consecutive downlink subframes NPRS with PRS, ref TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.15 Number of Antenna Ports EUTRA IE Semantics: Number of used antenna ports, where n1-or-n2 corresponds to 1 or 2 ports, n4 corresponds to 4 ports

9.2.15 SFN Initialisation Time EUTRA IE Semantics: Time in seconds relative to 00:00:00 on 1 January 1900 (calculated as continuous time without leap seconds and traceable to a common time reference) where binary encoding of the integer part is in the first 32 bits and binary encoding of the fraction part in the last 32 bits. The fraction part is expressed with a granularity of 1 /2**32 second.

9.2.15 NG-RAN Access Point Position IE Semantics: The configured estimated geographical position of the antenna of the cell/TP. 9.2.10 NG-RAN Access Point Position - Section Description: The NG-RAN Access Point Position IE is used to identify the geographical position of an NG-RAN Access Point. It is expressed as ellipsoid point with altitude and uncertainty ellipsoid according to TS 23.032 [8].
9.2.10 Degrees Of Latitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N223 X /90  N+1 X being the latitude in degrees (0°.. 90°).
9.2.10 Degrees Of Longitude IE Semantics: The IE value (N) is derived by this formula: N224 X /360  N+1 X being the longitude in degrees (-180°..+180°).

9.2.10 Altitude IE Semantics: The relation between the value (N) and the altitude (a) in meters it describes is N ( a < N+1, except for N=215-1 for which the range is extended to include all greater values of (a).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-major IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty semi-minor IE Semantics: The uncertainty "r" is derived from the "uncertainty code" k by r = 10x(1.1k-1).
9.2.10 Uncertainty Altitude IE Semantics: The uncertainty altitude "h" expressed in metres is derived from the "uncertainty code" k, by: h=45x(1.025k-1).

9.2.15 PRS Muting Configuration EUTRA IE Semantics: The configuration of positioning reference signals muting pattern. 9.2.16 PRS Muting Configuration EUTRA - Section Description: The PRS Muting Configuration EUTRA IE is used to describe the configuration of PRS muting patterns for the concerned cell/TP, according to TS 36.211 [10] and TS 36.133 [9].

9.2.16 Two IE Semantics: If a bit is set to "0", it indicates that the PRS is muted in the corresponding PRS positioning occasion (numbering from any sub frame for which SFN=0) in a periodic cycle of length equal to the length of the bit string
9.2.16 Four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 Eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 Sixteen IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 thirty-two IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 sixty-four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 one-hundred-and-twenty-eight IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 two-hundred-and-fifty-six IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 five-hundred-and-twelve IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.16 one-thousand-and-twenty-four IE Semantics: Same as above
9.2.15 PRS-ID EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS ID, ref TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.15 TP-ID EUTRA IE Semantics: Identity of the transmission point. This IE together with the PCI and/or PRS-ID may be used to identify the transmission point in case the same physical cell ID is shared by multiple transmission points.
9.2.15 TP Type EUTRA IE Semantics: A TP which transmits PRS only.
9.2.15 Number of DL Frames-Extended EUTRA IE Semantics: Number of consecutive downlink subframes NPRS with PRS, ref TS 36.211 [10].
9.2.15 CRS CP Length EUTRA IE Semantics: Cyclic prefix length of the CRS.
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ...)
9.2.15 DL Bandwidth EUTRA IE Semantics: DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks NRB, ref TS 36.104 [7].
ENUMERATED (og2, og4, og8, og16, og32, og64, og128, ...)
9.2.15 PRS Occasion Group EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS occasion group in a PRS period, ref TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.15 PRS Frequency Hopping Configuration EUTRA IE Semantics: PRS frequency hopping configuration. 9.2.17 PRS Frequency Hopping Configuration EUTRA - Section Description: The PRS Frequency Hopping Configuration EUTRA IE is used to describe the configuration of PRS frequency hopping for the concerned cell/TP, according to TS 36.211 [10].
9.2.17 Number of Frequency Hopping Bands IE Semantics: Number of bands for frequency hopping.
9.2.17 NarrowBand Index IE Semantics: Narrowband Index
ENUMERATED ( sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6, … )

9.2.15 TDD Configuration EUTRA IE Semantics: TDD specific physical channel configuration. 9.2.18 TDD Configuration EUTRA - Section Description: The TDD Configuration EUTRA IE is used to specify the TDD specific physical channel configuration. 9.2.18 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: sa0 points to Configuration 0, sa1 to Configuration 1 etc. as specified in TS 36.211 [6, table 4.2-2].
